list_definition.definition: to go to or be present at

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He will attend school till he is sixteen.

list_definition.definition: (with to) formal to listen or give attention to

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Attend carefully to what the teacher is saying!
I’ll attend to that problem tomorrow.

list_definition.definition: to look after; to help or serve

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Two doctors attended her all through her illness
The queen was attended by four ladies-in-waiting.

list_ex_of_english: The remainder were either not contacted or were unable to give any definite reason for not attending.
I attended both symposia and found both those and the book extremely interesting.
Pensioners attending these activities were generally healthy, mobile, and came from diverse socio-economic backgrounds.
Their rejection of qualia, however, is less persuasive; as is their view that we see only what we are attending to.
All children in this sample attended special education preschools and received either speech and/or physical therapy.
In addition, all children attended regular classrooms, although 12% of the sample was in classrooms with younger classmates because of grade retention.
Even by the second meeting most sessions were halved - only 75 people attended in one committee.
A thousand women, not all newlyweds, attended at least once.
